title: Tosefta Tevul Yom
enDesc: The Tosefta (Supplement, addition") is a compilation of the Jewish oral law. Opinions differ widely as to when the Tosefta was redacted and how it relates to the Mishnah. However it closely corresponds to the Mishnah in structure and style, with the same divisions for sedarim ("orders") and masekhot ("tractates"). In many ways, the Tosefta acts as a supplement to the Mishnah. It is mainly written in Mishnaic Hebrew, with some Aramaic. Tevul Yom (Immersed [on that] day) belongs to the sixth order, Tahorot (Purities) and discusses a special kind of impurity where the person immerses in a mikveh (ritual bath) but is still unclean for the rest of the day. It has two chapters.
